module.title: name-descriptions
module.p: Name-descriptions are names which have been created from a definite common noun phrase.
Name-descriptions can be classified into two distinct grammatical types, based on the kinds of words they are made out of –

ol.li: pre-specified name-descriptions – the common noun is specified by a form of the definite article, e.g. Am Moireach The Duke of Atholl, Am Ploc Plockton, An Seann-Tiomnadh The Old Testament

post-specified name-descriptions – the common noun is specified by a following genitive word or phrase, e.g. Fear Chìosmuil MacNeil of Barra, Baile Ùr an t-Slèibhe Newtonmore, Òran na Cloiche [song title]

module.p: Like other names, name-descriptions can also be classified into a number of different semantic types, depending on the kind of entity named –
An Fhraing France, An Fhraingis French – proper name-descriptions
